snippet: The tradition of performing monkeys has fallen on hard times in China, but trainers hope their animal’s turn on the Chinese zodiac cycle will improve business.
abstract: Monkey trainers in China say they are optimistic Year of Monkey will revive goodwill toward centuries-old tradition, saying monkey-themed new year has already created more demand for their trade; buskers, who teach macaques tricks to perform for street crowds, have faced uncertain future due to animal abuse allegations, police crackdowns and audience indifference.
lead_paragraph: The tradition of performing monkeys has fallen on hard times in China, but trainers hope their animal’s turn on the Chinese zodiac cycle will improve business.

headline.main: Chinese Animal Trainers Looking for Respect in the Year of the Monkey
headline.print_headline: Reviving a Tradition in the Year of the Monkey
